title: I am very good at talking but when it comes to writing (for example, emails), I just lose it. How can I be an effective email writer? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi! First of all, Clearly decide purpose of the emailpunch out points on a Google Doc/ Evernote page before including in your emailThe points can include Salutation (Dear Sir/ Ma’am), Greetings, any reference of having met the person before, help that you require or an appointment, invitation to your school/college/organization as Guest Speaker etc.Remember and include name of any of your contacts who referred or recommended this person to you. Please include your contact person in the cc for this mail.Clearly mention the CTA - Call to Action/ help that you want in a polite manner saying. May I request you to please connect me with XYZ or let me know your availability for a face to face or Skype meeting etc.If it is an invite, then include your seniors - Faculty/ Managers/ VPs in the cc.Before closing, include Kind Regards, below it Thank You & a standard signature at the end of email. This signature must be already set in your Google Settings - under Email signature in your Gmail with your name, designation/ job title, name of organization/College, your contact number, link of LinkedIn Profile/ Social media (Most active account) (As shown in screenshot) 8. Once the whole text is typed out on Google doc, please paste it in the email body. Attach any document if required. And, press ‘Send.’ Most important - After sending email, you need to follow-up with the person through call or another email within 2 or 3 days. You are good to go in this manner for any email that you write in future. Best Wishes Cheers Sneha
